title: 'Free Money': These Are the Hottest Airdrops Around Right Now
subtitle_generated: Discover the latest token airdrops in the crypto space and how you can participate
summary: Jito, a Solana DeFi protocol, recently launched its JTO token airdrop with a collective value of $225 million.
Starknet, an Ethereum layer-2 scaling network, plans to host a STRK token airdrop soon for early users and contributors.
Blast, an upcoming Ethereum layer-2 scaling network, has generated significant interest with traders staking $834 million worth of ETH in hopes of earning airdropped tokens.
Jupiter, a popular Solana DeFi aggregator, is expected to have a notable airdrop soon for nearly a million eligible wallets.
Portal, a gaming token project, is incentivizing Twitter users to spread the word about its upcoming airdrop, aiming to bridge the gap between crypto games with a single cross-chain token.

title: NuggetRush Smashes Past $850,000 Raised, Price Jumps 30%
subtitle_generated: NuggetRush emerges as a strong contender in the world of meme coins with its unique value proposition and real-world impact.
summary: NuggetRush (NUGX) challenges the dominance of Dogecoin in the cryptocurrency market.
NUGX distinguishes itself by blending gaming thrills with real-world impact through GameFi.
The tokenomics of NUGX are strategically designed for price appreciation.
NuggetRush aims to make a tangible difference by supporting artisanal miners in underdeveloped regions.
The project incorporates a secure and transparent marketplace for in-game assets and NFTs.

title: U.S., South Korea, Japan Discuss North Korean Crypto Thefts in Trilateral Meeting
subtitle_generated: National security officials meet to address North Korea's crypto thefts and weapons programs
summary: U.S., South Korean, and Japanese national security advisors discuss North Korea's cryptocurrency thefts and illicit weapons program.
The advisors review progress on trilateral initiatives, including regional crises, ballistic missile defense, and responses to North Korea's use of cryptocurrency.
They also discuss North Korea's relationship with Russia and joint efforts to seize cybercriminals' assets.
The U.S. Treasury Department has sanctioned entities involved in money laundering and supporting North Korea's weapons program.
Notably, privacy tool Tornado Cash and its developers have faced charges and sanctions for their alleged involvement in laundering stolen cryptocurrency.
